Not sure why you're getting downvoted, this makes perfect sense. It didn't bother me that Starfleet *finally* has a fleet of battle-ready starships on call. Imagine how many times that would have been useful over the years, and in a Federation with hundreds of billions of people it shouldn't be difficult to keep them staffed. In fact, it seems ridiculous to assume that Starfleet Command would continue to have their scrapped-together fleets blown up with no thought as to fixing the problem.

My issue is that the fleets were so big that they were ridiculous. A secret cabal had a fleet larger than any Romulan fleet we have ever seen. Starfleet just happened to have their own massive fleet of roughly the same size, within an equal warp distance. Either Starfleet had the best intelligence available (and yet didn't realize that the flag officer in charge of security was a spy and the leader of the enemy force), or they just did it for the plot. And that just seems lazy.
